Larynx - rest fingers on bone and then move up half an inch

Arm Pressure Points
details:
1. Top of mountain
2. Wrist (4 fingers up from hand)
3. Bicep
advancedNotes:
- Top of mountain = LI-10
- 4 fingers = HT-4
- Bicep = UE-9

Top of the mountain tip - rest hand on forearm, let arm fall naturally until fingers catch

The either side of the bicep points are LI-13 and HT-2

Fourth finger squeeze or hit

name: Wrist Locks from Various Grabs
details: Technique must be done from a standard grab as well as from other grabs. Student must determine how to apply from various grabs.

- 1x takedown with wrist lock #2

Chin - thumb on chin

name: Shoulder Lock: Wrist to Elbow to Shoulder
Middle Chest Grab Wrist Locks
details:
1. 2 hand twist
2. Hand wrist lock with shoulder turn
advancedNotes:
#1: Arm should be vertical; pin to chest. Can strike top of mountain to get arm vertical. Hand on top should be same side as hand partner is grabbing.
#2: Pickle jar; wringing the towel

name: Defense against any attacks requested by judges
Submission of Thesis Required Prior to Taking 1st Dan Exam
Expanded Pressure Points
advancedNotes:
Head/neck:
-ST-5 - Middle of jaw neck turn
- ST-9, SI-16 (combined with LI-18) - Three neck pressure points w/ knife hand
- GB-21 - Top of traps

Body
- CO-17 - Breastbone (strike)
- LV-13 - Liver shot
- CO-15 - Xiphoid process

Back
- SI-11, SI-12, SI-13 - Scapula
- BL-10 - Back of neck, either side of spine

Arm
- LU-1 - Front of shoulder
- LI-14 - Front of arm, just below deltoid
- TW-11 - Just above back of elbow
- PC-6 - Center of wrist
